oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ECONOMICS OF MAIZE PRODUCTION UNDER DIFFERENT COWPEA-BASED GREEN MANURE PRACTICES IN DERIVED SAVANNA ZONE OF NIGERIA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fabunmi, Thomas. O.
Agbonlahor, Mure. U
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Composting and manuring
Africa
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: There is a challenge in Nigeria of how to sustainably increase land productivity in the face of land pressures, un-availability and/or high cost of fertilizers, and reduced fallow periods. The present study analyzed the economic potential of producing maize under different regimes of cowpea green manure cropping.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Fabunmi, Thomas. O. and Agbonlahor, Mure. U (2012) ECONOMICS OF MAIZE PRODUCTION UNDER DIFFERENT COWPEA-BASED GREEN MANURE PRACTICES IN DERIVED SAVANNA ZONE OF NIGERIA. Journal of Organic Systems, 7 (2), pp. 5-13.
